txt.en: 'The cold on a winter night has cruel teeth that can bite through even the thickest layer of pelts.'
'Winter is a harsh master in these lands. Why now do so many outsiders come to suffer its icy grip?'
'The creatures of this land have always been hardy, as they must be simply to survive.'
'It is both courtesy and wisdom for travellers to seek our chieftain's favour.'
'What know you of our ways? Favour is not merely bestowed; it is earned!'
